update.description: * This PR fixes the bug of the toJson variable where it was being ignored and always set to true.
update.title: Fixing 'toJson' option in subscribe.

update.description: * This PR fixes the bug of the toJson variable where it was being ignored and always set to true.
update.title: Fixing 'toJson' option in subscribe.

content.raw: sorry, you're right, it is a wrong check.
content.html: sorry, you're right, it is a wrong check.

It wasn't working because the check the options had a bug. Putting the check inside the subscription only moved the bug. Try something like:

Gazebo.prototype.subscribe = function(type, topic, cb, options) {
    var latch = false
    var json = true
    if(options){
        if (typeof options['latch'] == "boolean") latch = options.latch
        if (typeof options['toJson'] == "boolean") json = options.toJson
    }
    this.sim.subscribe(type, topic, function(err, data) {
        if(err){
            cb(err)
            return
        }
        var result = data
        if (json) {
            // parse the string into a json msg
            result = JSON.parse(data)
        }
        cb(err, result)
    }, latch)
}

content.raw: The test is 'toJson" set to false'  (with a missing "). So the expected result should be a string
content.html: The test is 'toJson" set to false' (with a missing "). So the expected result should be a string

content.raw: yes, it would, but it wasn't working for me, thats why i moved it inside.
content.html: yes, it would, but it wasn't working for me, thats why i moved it inside.

content.raw: the return shouldn't be string, its json by default.
content.html: the return shouldn't be string, its json by default.

content.raw: The code is more efficient if you check the 'toJson' option once at the begining, instead of each time there is a callback. Please move the check outside.
content.html: The code is more efficient if you check the 'toJson' option once at the begining, instead of each time there is a callback. Please move the check outside.

content.raw: Should you check for string instead of object?
content.html: Should you check for string instead of object?

content.raw: there is no return after this callback... control will continue at line 172 and callback will be called again with JSON
content.html: there is no return after this callback... control will continue at line 172 and callback will be called again with JSON

content.raw:
You should use the toJson variable here, this would avoid to recompute it each time a new message comes in. 
If there's a reason not to use it, then it looks like it should be removed.
content.html: You should use the toJson variable here, this would avoid to recompute it each time a new message comes in. If there's a reason not to use it, then it looks like it should be removed.
